text: Charles William Kennett "Charlie" Baillie (4 September 1902 - 5 October 1987) was a British swimmer. He competed in the men's 100 metre freestyle event at the 1924 Summer Olympics. Baillie was the son of an Edinburgh baths attendant. Baillie was also a club water polo player. He was also a police officer, working for the forces in Edinburgh and Oldham. ==References== Category:1902 births Category:1987 deaths Category:British male swimmers Category:Olympic swimmers of Great Britain Category:Swimmers at the 1924 Summer Olympics Category:People from Edinburgh Category:Male freestyle swimmers
title: Charles Baillie (swimmer)
